meanings.definition: To convert (energy) from one form to another.
meanings.sent1: The solar panels transduce sunlight into electricity.
meanings.sent2: The microphone transduces sound waves into electrical signals.
meanings.sent3: The superhero's power is to transduce sunlight into laser beams.
meanings.sent4: Her smile seemed to transduce happiness to everyone around her.
meanings.sent5: The windmill's blades transduce the wind's energy into rotational motion.

meanings.definition: To convert (a signal) from one form to another.
meanings.sent1: The radio transduces radio waves into music.
meanings.sent2: The modem transduces digital data into analog signals.
meanings.sent3: The translator's job is to transduce language from one to another.
meanings.sent4: His artistry can transduce emotions into beautiful melodies.
meanings.sent5: The converter box transduces the TV signal for older TVs.

meanings.definition: To convert (genetic information) from one form to another.
meanings.sent1: The cell transduces genetic information during replication.
meanings.sent2: The virus transduces its genetic material into the host cell.
meanings.sent3: The geneticist's experiment aimed to transduce DNA sequences.
meanings.sent4: The gene therapy can transduce healthy genes into diseased cells.
meanings.sent5: The genetic mutation can transduce harmful traits to offspring.
